meanings.definition: A member of certain peoples of very short stature in equatorial Africa and parts of Southeast Asia.
meanings.sent1: The pygmy from Africa was known for their small stature.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring a pygmy from Southeast Asia.
meanings.sent3: The pygmy tried to reach the top shelf but couldn't quite make it.
meanings.sent4: In a world of giants, she felt like a pygmy, always overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The tiny pygmy stood out in the crowd of taller individuals.

meanings.definition: A person of unusually small size.
meanings.sent1: The circus featured a talented pygmy who amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: Despite his small size, he had a big heart, just like a true pygmy.
meanings.sent3: The pygmy tried to ride the roller coaster but was too short to meet the height requirement.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a pygmy in the land of giants, always struggling to be seen.
meanings.sent5: The little pygmy was the smallest but bravest of them all.

meanings.definition: A very small or diminutive person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The tiny plant in the garden was like a pygmy among the flowers.
meanings.sent2: She found a pygmy seashell on the beach, a rare and delicate treasure.
meanings.sent3: The pygmy mushroom was so small it could fit on a fingertip.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the pygmy squirrel moved quickly and unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The pygmy star in the sky twinkled faintly, almost invisible to the naked eye.
